txt.en: 'I am glad to see the House of Eorl restored to its glory!'
'But what of Meriadoc the Halfling?'
'You must make him a knight of the Mark, for he is valiant beyond measure!'
'Health I may yet have, if there is an empty saddle for me to fill. But hope? I do not know.'
'I would not have believed the weed could smell so sweet!'
'It puts me in mind of the roses of Imloth Melui, when I was young.'
'Kingsfoil is well-named, for what king could ask for better?'
'A King, just as I said! Did you hear that? The hands of a healer, I said!'
'My lord... you called for me...'
'What does the king command?'
'I do, my king. I want nothing but to climb from this bed and serve you.'
'I will rest, if that is your command.'
'But what man could lie idle when the king has come again?'

Aragorn's skill at healing will be put to the test in the Houses of Healing.
'Let us see if Faramir's condition has improved, [placeholder].'
'DNT - Blah!'
'DNT - Blah!'
'I may be able to cure the hurts of her body, and draw her back from the darkness.'
'DNT - Blah!'
'But if she wakes to that old despair, there is no healing I can give that will cure her of it.'
'Éowyn, daughter of Éomund, awake! Your enemy is gone, and will trouble you no more!'
'He will be fine. I came in time, and have called him back.'

'It is good to see you again, [placeholder]! Do you remember when we crept to see Théoden's war-council in the Drúadan Forest? It feels to me as if that was years and years ago, but it cannot have been. I have been caught in a terrible dream, but already the memory of it is fading.\n\n'I think supper will be just the thing, and afterwards perhaps a pipe. No, not a pipe. I don't think I will ever smoke again. Théoden was sorry he would not be able to speak of herb-lore with me, smoking our pipes in comfort and peace. I will never be able to smoke without thinking of him.'
'The wound he suffered will heal, and I know there is strength in his spirit.'
'Master Meriadoc... your friends are here, and they wish to see you.'
'And why should you not, Merry?'
'DNT - Blah!'
'Light your pipe and think of him, for he kept his oaths and proved a great king.'
Remain alert in the event you are needed
'He would be glad for you to think of him over a pleasant smoke, I think.'
Follow Aragorn to Éowyn's bedside

Faramir has recovered, and now Aragorn goes to see if Éowyn's condition has improved.
Aragorn is by Éowyn's bedside in the Houses of Healing.
'But not entirely, Éomer, for you had deeds of arms and the riding of the free fields to occupy your mind.'
Aragorn is by Merry's bedside in the Houses of Healing.
'Éowyn did not, though she was your equal in spirit and courage.'
'He lies also in this house, and I will go now to him, but Éomer will stay yet awhile.'
Merry is still in bed, but he seems to be recovering.
'Speak no more of war until you are restored to health, and renewed of hope!'

'Thank you for all your help, [placeholder]. We have done much good here, and there is more to do before I can rest. But I am glad that some of the evils that befell us upon Pelennor have been remedied.'
'I am certain as well, and it is said I know a thing or two.'
'Indeed, for this Rider of Rohan I believe nothing will be held back.'
'His name will be held in high honour within the city!'
Instance: The Hands of a Healer
Aragorn is by Faramir's bedside in the Houses of Healing.
'I do not know why you ask this of me, Aragorn.'
DNT - Blah!
'She tended to Théoden in his growing despair and sickness, it is true.'
DNT - Blah!
'That unhappiness was ours to share.'
'Mayhap I should have known, but I did not. I weep that this was to be her lot!'
DNT - Blah!
'Éowyn, Éowyn!'
DNT - Blah!
'The Lord of the Mark is dead, but he bade me give his farewell to Éowyn, dearer than a daughter to him.'
'He lies now in the Citadel of Gondor, as befits the great honour with which he passed from this life.'
'Is he going to be all right, Strider?'
'It is past supper-time, Merry. But I am certain they will let me bring you something!'
'I am hungry. What time is it?'
'You may be right! Thank you, Strider!'
Comfort Merry
'I crushed some of the kingsfoil leaves and cast them into steaming water.'
'Your healing-skill is to be commended, Aragorn.'
'Let us see if the healing odour refreshes Faramir's body and spirit.'
'You know of me?'
'You will serve me best by resting awhile, and having some food.'
'You have walked in the shadows for too long, and are weary.'
'Farewell for now.'
'It proved sufficient for Faramir, but Éowyn's suffering is of a different sort.'
'Éowyn's suffering began before ever she faced the Witch-king, Éomer, did it not?'
'Her unhappiness was clear to me at the moment of our first meeting.'
'Éomer, my brother. You live? They said you were slain...'
'No, it must have been the voices in my dream that said that was so.'
'What of Théoden? Do not tell me that was a dream as well, for I know it was not.'
